definitions.definition: To frighten or cause hesitation ; to daunt , put off ( usually used in the negative ) ; to disconcert , to perturb .
examples: Jumping out of an airplane does not faze him, yet he is afraid to ride a roller coaster.

main_definition: ( transitive , informal ) To frighten or cause hesitation ; to daunt , put off ( usually used in the negative ) ; to disconcert , to perturb . [from mid 19th c.]
